A.name: Alzheimer's Disease
A.description: A progressive neurodegenerative disease that causes memory loss, confusion, and changes in thinking patterns.
A.cause: Primarily genetic factors, with other environmental factors potentially contributing.
A.precaution: Regular mental stimulation, healthy diet, and physical activity may help delay onset.

A.name: ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis)
A.description: A progressive neurological disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and the spinal cord.
A.cause: Mostly unknown, but some genetic factors are involved.
A.precaution: There is no cure; however, therapy and medications can slow progression.

A.name: Anemia
A.description: A condition in which there is a deficiency of red cells or of hemoglobin in the blood.
A.cause: Caused by lack of iron, chronic diseases, or inherited disorders.
A.precaution: Iron supplements and dietary changes can help manage anemia.

B.name: Brain Tumor
B.description: An abnormal mass of tissue in the brain that can disrupt normal brain functions.
B.cause: Causes may be genetic mutations or exposure to radiation.
B.precaution: Early diagnosis, radiation therapy, and surgery can help manage symptoms.

B.name: Bipolar Disorder
B.description: A mental health condition causing extreme mood swings including emotional highs (mania) and lows (depression).
B.precaution: Mood stabilizers, therapy, and lifestyle management can help control the condition.

B.name: Bronchitis
B.description: Inflammation of the lining of bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from the lungs.
B.cause: Caused by viruses, bacteria, or irritants like tobacco smoke.
B.precaution: Avoid smoking, rest, and medication can help manage symptoms.

C.name: Cerebral Palsy
C.description: A group of disorders affecting movement and muscle tone, caused by damage to the brain before or at birth.
C.cause: Brain injury or abnormal development during pregnancy or early life.
C.precaution: Physical therapy and medication can help manage symptoms.

C.name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
C.description: A complex disorder characterized by extreme fatigue that can't be explained by any underlying medical condition.
C.cause: Exact cause is unknown, but viral infections and psychological stress are believed to play a role.
C.precaution: Graded exercise therapy and cognitive behavioral therapy may help alleviate symptoms.

C.name: Cystic Fibrosis
C.description: A hereditary disorder affecting the exocrine glands, leading to the production of thick mucus that blocks airways.
C.cause: Caused by a mutation in the CFTR gene.
C.precaution: Regular chest physiotherapy, medication, and proper nutrition help manage the condition.
